New Records: Senegal secured their first win in the 2026 World Cup qualifying campaign with a 1-0 victory over Mauritania in Nouakchott on Sunday, June 9, 2024, despite missing key players Sadio Man√© and Nicolas Jackson due to injuries.
Key Match Events: The match was halted for a significant period in the second half due to objects being thrown onto the pitch by frustrated home fans.
Post-Match Reflections: Senegal moved to the top of Group B with a victory, while Mauritania fell to their first defeat of the qualifying campaign.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was part of the broader 2026 World Cup qualifying campaign, with Senegal and Tunisia both aiming to secure their places in the tournament.
